**Discharge Summary**

Dear ___,

I am writing to provide a summary of your hospital stay and the medical treatment you received during your admission from the 10th of March to the 20th of March, 2024. 

Upon admission, it was noted that you experienced a fall, which resulted in a subsequent loss of consciousness. This incident led to a decreased level of consciousness, with particular concerns about slurring of speech and impaired motor skills. Your Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) was recorded at 11, indicating a moderate degree of neurological impairment.

The following day, a CT scan was conducted and confirmed the presence of a hemorrhagic stroke in the right hemisphere of your brain. This diagnosis was formally categorized as an intracerebral hemorrhage. Consequently, it was decided to initiate treatment with Mannitol to manage potential cerebral edema. Additionally, antihypertensive medication was administered to manage blood pressure levels.

Results from laboratory tests, specifically a complete blood count (CBC), indicated a slightly low hemoglobin level and elevated white blood cell count. The coagulation profile showed an elevated International Normalized Ratio (INR), suggesting a prolonged bleeding time which correlated with your condition.

Throughout your stay, various ward round assessments recorded no significant improvement initially in your neurological status, with continued monitoring due to symptoms of agitation and confusion. The safety measures were put in place to prevent any further falls, given your state. Discussions were held with your family regarding your prognosis and future care needs, emphasizing the critical nature of your condition.

I hope this summary provides a comprehensive overview of the medical care you received during your stay. Should you or your family have any further questions or require more information, please feel free to contact us.

Wishing you a smooth and steady recovery.

Warm regards,

Dr. ___
